text:
Sustainability runs
through my veins,

as I was born and raised in
an extra-large family of 15
people.

So we learned to make the
most out of our resources.

I reused most of
my older brother's

school uniforms, books, school
supplies, and textbooks.

We bought food in Santiago's
largest wholesale markets
and cooked in bulk.

I became aware of the
importance of minimizing waste,

and I learned to save
water and energy costs.

To work together
towards this goal,

we had to learn to celebrate
diversity, and each person's
unique talent.

My family's occupations
range from a priest,
to a chef, and an actress.

Learning to get along
with my siblings

shaped how I think and
approach problems, inspiring me

to leverage diversity to tackle
complex, multidisciplinary
problems.

What matters most to me
is building a sustainable

family, community,
and world to leverage

my country's great diversity
to protect Chile's environment,

and work towards building
a carbon-neutral country.
